title: Enhance INVOICE folder with Data Best model logic in M2M Self Service Portal
description:
Description
1. Epic Description
Epic (Requirement and Scope) 
Currently in the TMSP we have the dynamic pooling model, that presents the sum of all per SIM inclusive volume of the SIMs per month in the pooling tariff. Each SIM contributes a certain predefined volume to the corresponding pool when activated and the pool size grows depending on the number of the active SIMs in this pool tariff automatically. The customer must know which use cases are affected and must calculate the needed volume exactly depending on the number of his active SIMs to implement his business before signing the contract with the corresponding sales MNO (TDG, TMA, ...).
The epic aims to improve the functionality of data for the Data Best Pool Model within the Self Service Portal. Currently, the Data Best folder has not enough attributes in Self Service Portal lacks the capability for creating more comprehensive reports.
As part of our continuous improvement of the M2M Self Service Portal, we need to integrate the DATA_BEST model logic into the SIM_PROFILE  folder. This integration will enhance the portal's capabilities and provide users with more robust data management and analytical tools.
Target Requirements/ User Stories:
Adjust PARTNER_LEVEL_SERVICE folder with Data Best model
Enhance STANDARD_OFFERING with Data Best Pool Model
Enhance CUSTOMER_OFFERING with Data Best Pool Model
Adjust INVOICE folder with Data Best model
Add new folder for Static Pooling model in INVOICE folder
  MVP
Improve the functionality of the M2M Self Service Portal, enabling users to effortlessly generate detailed reports tailored to their specific requirements.
Streamline the user interface of the portal to enhance usability and facilitate intuitive navigation for all users.
Implement optimizations to ensure the portal operates efficiently, providing quick response times even when handling complex queries and large datasets.
Benefits
 Power users in departments can leverage the portal to access relevant data directly, promoting transparency and enabling them to address queries independently.
 By providing users with the tools to generate their own reports, the need for manual service requests diminishes, freeing up resources and reducing the workload on support teams. This leads to greater efficiency and cost savings for the organization.
With enhanced report generation capabilities, users gain greater control over accessing and analyzing data, empowering them to make informed decisions.
 By enabling users to generate sophisticated reports based on their unique needs, the portal facilitates deeper insights into data, driving better-informed decision-making processes
By integrating the DATA_BEST model logic, users will have access to more accurate and comprehensive data analysis tools, leading to better-informed business decisions.
More than 150 for TDG customers will benefit from the demand
More than 1000 customers expected by marketing of the data best pooling model products
More than 10 Mio SIM Cards will be impacted by the demand

Specific Deliverables  
None
  Acceptance Criteria (conditions which must be satisfied for the Epic to be accepted)
The DATA_BEST model logic is successfully integrated into the INVOICE folder.
All existing functionalities of the M2M Self Service Portal remain unaffected by the integration.
Users can access and utilize the Data Best model logic without issues.
Out of Scope
Creation of new reports, system architecture changes. BI Launchpad reports are not affected.
Dependencies 
The mapping in the source system is clear and accessible, and the changes have been approved by a business side.
2. Technical / Solution Design / Compliance
Technical & Solution Design  
The proposed solution involves modifying existing folders to incorporate additional attributes and relationships, as well as updating the logic within the M2M Self Service Portal for creating necessary internal reports. This aligns with the architectural roadmap by ensuring compatibility with current systems and minimizing disruption. The implementation will utilize existing technologies and frameworks, focusing on improving performance while maintaining data integrity. The mapping in the source system is clear and accessible, ensuring a smooth integration process.
